note.p: Education: Trinity College Cambridge, BA, Hon LL.D 1911

Career: Member of Parliament for West Derbyshire (1891-1908); Treasurer of Household (1900-1903); Financial Secretary to the Treasurer (1903-1905); sworn of Privy Council (1905); Civil Lord of Admiralty (1915-1910); Governor General and Commander in Chief of the dominion of Canada (1916-1922); Secretrary of State for colonies (1922-1924); Knight of Justice, Order o St John of Jerusalem, Deputy Lieutenant and Justive of the Peace of Lancashire; President, Derbyshire Territorial Army Association; High Steward of Derby; High Steward, University and Borough of Cambridge; Chancellor, University of Leeds (1990); Vice-Priesident, Navy League (1909); honrary Colonel, 5th Battalion the Sherwood Foresters ; Honorary Colonel, 24th (derby Yeomanry) Armed Car Company, RTR; Colonel, Derbyshire Volunteer Regiment; Major, Derbyshire Yeomanry; Mayor of Eastbourne (1909-1910); and of Chesterfield (1911-1912).
Freemason, initiated, as Victor Cavendish, 4 March 1890, isaac Newton university Lodge No 859, Cambridge, passed 29 April 1890 and raised 27 May 1890.
Obituaries: Obituary Notices of Fellows of the Royal Society 1936-1938 vol 2 pp 557-559, plate, by R Whiddington
The Library and Museum of Freemasonry, ;Freemasons and the Royal Society; Alphabetical List of Fellows of the Royal Society who were Freemasons' (2010) page 18
